args: More like non-existent.\nWe've had zero customers.
Word must have gotten out about\nyesterday's...incident.
If customers don't start pouring in\nby the wagonload, we're going to\nstart hemorrhaging money.
Right. I won't be able to pay you.
Gah. Well, pay or no pay, I'm mortified.\nI'm the one who let my emotions run wild\nand ousted that dragon from the premises.
I should have known better. Dragons and\nhumans are not so different, after all.\nOur hearts beat just the same.
I swore an oath to protect one and all\nfrom sadness, and yet my actions did\njust the opposite!
I understand your frustration, Amane,\nbut we need to take action, not wallow\nin regret.
You speak true. We need to drum up\nsome fresh clientele. Give me a day\nand I'll have this sorted.
Oh? You have a plan, then?
First, I'll apologize to that dragon. I vow\nto give him an experience so positive that\nit makes up for my offense tenfold.
I realize this is a selfish request, butâ€”
Say no more. Regaining customers' trust\nis a key part of rebuilding our business.\nI'll be happy to help.
You have my thanks, Master! Let us give\nhim the best welcome we possibly can.
First, we need to decorate the restaurant\nand prepare a master-class menu...\nEr, do dragons even eat human food?
We should probably find a dragon to ask.
But we can't just hope a dragon we're on\nspeaking terms with will happen to strollâ€”\nwait, I know one I can ask!
Mariti is here to answer your call!
I appreciate you coming on\nsuch short notice.
Don't sweat it! It sounds like the choir kids\nowe you, so I'm happy to repay the favor.
Much obliged. Now, I'd like your opinion.
This is the cuisine I was thinking about\nserving to a draconic customer of ours.\nDo you think it'd make him feel welcome?
Wooow... I'm pretty sure I looked up the\nword ï¼‚luxuryï¼‚ in a dictionary once and\nthis was, like, LITERALLY the picture!
Thank you. My master and I devised this\nrecipe after discussing which ingredients\nwould best suit a dragon's palate.
Naturally, dragonfruit is the star here.\nBest to start with a familiar base.
Iiinteresting. Can't say I've ever met a\ndragon that DOESN'T like dragonfruit, but...
...aren't you kinda missing the point here?
You're not trying to concoct a one-size-\nfits-all recipe for every dragon ever,\nare you? Just the dragon you drove away.
I think you should focus more on what\nHE likes rather than dragons in general.
You're right. Every dragon is unique,\njust like their human counterparts.\nI'm almost ashamed I didn't think of that.
My most straightforward route here would\nbe to talk to that dragon directly, but I'm\nafraid that's not really an option...
Did he say anything before he left?\nI can't imagine a dragon coming to a\nhuman restaurant without a reason.
I was hoping to sample the food of this\nwell-reputed restaurant in a land so dear\nto me...but I see it wasn't meant to be.
Come to think of it, wasn't there once\nanother restaurant in this very spot?
Perhaps he was nostalgic for the food\nthey used to serve. In which case...
...I'm going to recreate their cuisine!\nWould you do me the honor of being\nmy designated taste tester, Maritimus?
You don't have to ask me twice!
My tummy is READY!\nBut what is it?\nIt smells kind of spicy!
It's a dish called ï¼‚nostalgia noodles.ï¼‚\nThe previous restaurant in this space\nwas famous for them.
It's clear to me that the dragon still\ntreasures his memories of this area.
We need to respect and embrace those\nfeelings if we want to get on his good side.
You've helped me truly internalize\nthe idea that humans and dragons\nare one and the same.
Now, sample the savory fruit of my\nintrospection and render your judgment!
Mmm! Okay, yeah, this is gold-star good.
You can really taste the love in every bite!
I'm sure that once he tastes this, that\ndragon will understand your intentions.
I'll go see if I can rustle him up for you.\nGooood luck!
Hello. I'm here at Maritimus's insistence.
Given the abject terror you displayed\nwhen I last dropped by, I'm not sure\nwhat to expect with today's visit.
Thank you so much for coming!\nFirst, let me apologize for being\nso rude to you the other day.
Your appearance triggered a deep-seated\ntrauma that made me behave irrationally.\nTruly, it wasn't youâ€”it's me.
I'd like to make it up to you by way\nof this cuisine. I hope it suits you.
I cannot guarantee you will like it...\nbut would you try it all the same?
Oh! This looks exactly like the dish Simon\nand I once enjoyed in this very spot.
I would be glad to sample it.\n*munch* ...Great glutenous gracious!
It tastes splendidâ€”and that just makes\nthe kindness you have shown in making\nit hit home all the more.
I can tell that you genuinely wanted to\nmake up for hurting me, and to give me\nan experience to remember.
It has been a long time since anyone\nmade me feel so welcome. Thank you.
I'm not so naive as to think this negates\nmy prior bad behavior towards you, but...
...as an employee of the Kitty Cafe,\nI live to make my customers happy.\nThank you for allowing me the pleasure.
I feel like we're thanking each other\nin circles here, but I must say, this\nKitty Cafe of yours is something special.

I have fond memories of this area from
visiting with Simon. I see that the new
restaurant has earned its reputation, too.
I apologize for ever thinking otherwise.
I hope I will be welcome if I come again.
Oh, absolutely! We would love to have you!
'Scuse me! I'm, like, ready to order!
Good afternooâ€”whoa! There are so many\ncustomers! And isn't that Siren?
Erasmus has apparently been doing his\nown little PR campaign for the Kitty Cafe.
I believe his tagline was: ï¼‚Beachside\neats and dragon-approved treats!ï¼‚\nGuess the word-of-mouth is working!
Yay! I'm so happy for you guys!
Oh, hello. What brings you here today?
It's about time for us to head home, so\nwe figured we should come say goodbye.
Looks like everything here's running more\nsmoothly than a well-hydrated soprano.
It certainly is. Business is booming!
Good luck with everything!\nI'll be spreading the good word too.
Much obliged! You all were\ninstrumental in our newfound success.
Next time you come, dinner is on the\nhouse. Take care on the trip back!
